backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining Student, Milestone, Project, and ContactLink types with a Map store, exposing query functions to get a student by Principal, get all students, and return the caller's key.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented portfolio features (preloader, hero, timeline, skills, etc.) to their source files, component dependencies, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON dictionary providing one-sentence summaries of key frontend source files including App.tsx, globe/achievement components, contact form, and footer.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens (background, foreground, primary, chart colors, sidebar, etc.).
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell titled 'NEXUS' with a root div and a module script tag loading the React entry point.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that wraps the app in Accessibility and Cursor context providers, manages preloader state, and renders all portfolio sections (Hero through Footer) with student data from a query hook.
frontend/src/components/AccessibilitySet: Fixed-position settings panel with toggle buttons for reduced motion and high contrast modes, using the accessibility context hook.
frontend/src/components/Achievements.tsx: Global Impact section rendering animated stat cards with count-up numbers, a Three.js Earth globe with hoverable impact pillars, and a styled achievements list with neon icons.
frontend/src/components/AchievementToolt: Glassmorphism tooltip that displays a label and an animated count-up stat number, used when hovering globe impact pillars.
frontend/src/components/AIArtGallery.tsx: Displays a 2Ã—2 grid of AI art pieces rendered from a sprite-strip image, with hover-driven scale/rotation animations and neon glow effects.
frontend/src/components/AISandbox.tsx: Section component for the AI Sandbox that lays out ChatPanel, VoiceInput, GrowthPredictor, and AIArtGallery in a responsive grid with a scroll-triggered fade-in animation.
frontend/src/components/ChatPanel.tsx: A chat UI component that simulates an AI portfolio assistant, matching user input keywords to predefined responses about a student's skills, projects, and achievements with a typing delay effect.
frontend/src/components/CodeParticles.ts: A canvas-based animation component that renders floating code characters (symbols, keywords) drifting upward with neon colors, respecting reduced-motion accessibility preferences.
frontend/src/components/Contact.tsx: A contact section component that displays orbiting social icons (email, GitHub, LinkedIn) alongside a contact form, pulling link URLs from a backend-provided ContactLink array.
frontend/src/components/ContactForm.tsx: A contact form with name, email, and message fields that triggers a canvas particle burst animation on submission and shows a success state afterward.
frontend/src/components/CustomCursor.tsx: A custom cursor component that replaces the default cursor with a smoothly animated neon element, changing shape based on cursor context state and leaving a fading trail in 'orb' mode.
frontend/src/components/FlipCard.tsx: A 3D flip card component that displays a milestone's date and title on the front, revealing a full description on the back when hovered or focused.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: A simple footer component displaying the current year copyright, the NEXUS brand name, and a 'Built with caffeine.ai' attribution link.
frontend/src/components/GlobeScene.tsx: Renders an interactive 3D globe using React Three Fiber with a rotating Earth sphere, wireframe overlay, and clickable/hoverable impact pillars at geographic coordinates representing key stats.
Displays a bar chart of skill proficiency levels across past, present, and future phases, controlled by a range slider, using Recharts with phase-specific neon colors.
frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx: Hero section component with parallax mouse-tracking layers, a glassmorphism name card with fragment shard effects on hover, and CTA buttons, populated with student data.
frontend/src/components/HeroGrid.tsx: Three.js Canvas background for the hero section featuring an animated scrolling grid floor and floating semi-transparent planes representing math formulas.
frontend/src/components/MagneticButton.t: A button or anchor element that applies a magnetic offset transform toward the cursor on hover and updates the global cursor state to 'magnetic'.
frontend/src/components/OrbitingIcons.ts: Three.js Canvas scene with a pulsing core sphere and three orbiting colored cubes representing Email, GitHub, and LinkedIn, each triggering a callback on click.
frontend/src/components/Preloader.tsx: Canvas-based preloader that animates particles from random positions into a human silhouette shape through scatter, converge, hold, and explode phases before calling onComplete.
frontend/src/components/ProjectCard.tsx: Renders an individual project card with scroll-driven 3D rotation and hover effects; clicking expands it into a fullscreen modal with a holographic preview and external link.
frontend/src/components/Projects.tsx: Displays a horizontally scrollable gallery of ProjectCards with scroll-driven inertia rotation and a dynamic background color that shifts based on which card is centered.
frontend/src/components/SkillGlobe.tsx: Renders an interactive 3D globe of skill nodes using React Three Fiber, with connection lines, hover highlighting, and auto-rotation that respects reduced-motion preferences.
frontend/src/components/Skills.tsx: Skills section combining a 3D SkillGlobe visualization with a grid of color-coded skill badge pills, overlaid on a hex-grid background with floating code particles.
frontend/src/components/Timeline.tsx: Sticky horizontal timeline section that maps vertical page scroll to horizontal card scrolling through milestone FlipCards, with a dynamic background gradient and progress bar.
frontend/src/components/VoiceInput.tsx: Simulated voice interface component with an animated waveform visualizer that plays a fake 3-second listening sequence and displays a random pre-written response.
frontend/src/hooks/useAccessibility.ts: Defines an AccessibilityContext and a hook that manages reducedMotion and highContrast state, persisting preferences to localStorage and syncing with OS media queries.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, invalidating dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useCursorContext.ts: Defines a CursorContext and hooks for managing a custom cursor state with values like 'default', 'orb', 'beam', 'magnetic', and 'pointer'.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity authentication provider and hook using DFINITY's AuthClient, exposing login/logout functions and identity state to the React component tree.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides a useGetStudent hook that fetches student profile data from the ICP backend actor via React Query, falling back to hardcoded DEFAULT_STUDENT data if unavailable.
frontend/src/hooks/useScrollAnimation.ts: Exports useScrollAnimation for tracking element visibility and intersection progress via IntersectionObserver, and useCountUp for animating a number from zero to a target value.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet defining the futuristic NEXUS design system with CSS custom properties for neon colors, glassmorphism utilities, high-contrast and reduced-motion modes, and Tailwind base/component layers.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with NEXUS-specific neon and space colors, custom fonts (Orbitron, Space Mono, Inter), oklch-based semantic color tokens, and neon box-shadow utilities.
project_state.json: Defines the NEXUS portfolio project state including architecture notes, 8 themed sections, tech stack (React, Three.js, GSAP, Framer Motion, Lenis, TailwindCSS), required images, and a list of existing implemented features with their IDs and requirements.
